description: This interdisciplinary course explores the concepts, methods, and debates of digital humanities -
using digital tools to explore humanities disciplines such as literature, history, and philosophy
along with their broader engagements with arts, social sciences, and other fields.  Topics are
drawn from current cultural texts, critical theories, and networked environmental issues.
Students learn through hands-on research projects that examine the social, cultural, and ethical
contexts of digital scholarship as well as its applications and impacts.  Offered during Interim.
